Early History.{{Yearlink|-17600}}:
The super continent [[Merrouroboros]] was fractured by the [[First Sundering]]. The Moonshaes were after a continental plate shifted to the west. During this time, the Moonshaes were little more than a collection of hundreds of islands formed by volcanic peaks.{{Cite dragon/362/Grand History of the Realms: The Moonshaes|23-31}}
[[File:20080110 drfe map1full.jpg|thumb|250px|right|''Map of the Moonshae Isles circa {{Yearlink|-11000}}.'']]
Early History.{{Yearlink|-10500}}: The Moonshaes begun forming into their current shape. The [[Korinn Archipelago]] was formed. The [[LeShay]] founded the kingdom of [[Sarifal]], constructing the city of [[Karador]] on an island in the center of the lake within [[Myrloch Vale]].
Early History.{{Yearlink|-9800}}: [[Llewyrr]] refugees begun arriving to the islands. They are welcomed by the LeShay. The refugees settled in the mountains and form the kingdom of [[Synnoria]].
Early History.{{Yearlink|-8000}}: [[Dwarven]] refugees founded [[Dwarvenhome]] in the caverns beneath the islands.
Early History.{{Yearlink|-7000}}: Dwarven settlers founded [[Highhome]] in the [[Cambro Mountains]].
Early History.{{Yearlink|-6000}}: [[Grond Peaksmasher]] arrives in the Moonshaes, accompanied by a tribe of giants. They settled on [[Norland]] in the [[South Jotunhammer Mountains]].
Early History.{{Yearlink|-5000}}: Conflict erupted between the dwarves and firbolgs of the Isles. Underneath [[Icepeak (Oman's Isle)|Ice Peak]] on [[Oman's Isle]], Grond Peaksmasher was imprisoned. Without his guidance, the firbolgs of the Moonshaes become uncivilized.
Early History.{{Yearlink|-4000}}: Due to the frequent presence of [[artificer]]s from [[Imaskar]] in the Royal Court of Sarifal, it was thought that an alliance was established between the two kingdoms.
Early History.{{Yearlink|-2000}}: [[Kazgaroth]] begun to wreak havoc on the Moonshaes. It was unleashed by [[Malar]]. The children of the [[Earthmother]] united with the Llewyrr and dwarves to battle the Beast. [[Fomorian]]s were brought to the Moonshaes from the [[Feywild]] by Kazgaroth as allies. The conflict drags on for decades until the minions of Kazgaroth were driven to isolated corners of the Moonshaes. The fomorians conquer the firbolgs, forcing them into slavery.
Early History.{{Yearlink|-500}}: Most of the Fey, including the fomorians, abandoned their domains in the Moonshaes and retreated back into the Feywild. The kingdom of Sarifal is abandoned and the city of Karador sinks into the Myrloch.

Modern History.{{Yearlink|34}}: The [[Shadowking]] began his conquest of the [[Talfir]] people, the ancestors of the [[Ffolk]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|140}}: Refugees fleeing from the persecution of the Shadowking crossed the [[Sea of Swords]] and settled in the Moonshaes on the island of [[Gwynneth]], which they name after [[Gwynneth (person)|their leader]]. They became the Ffolk people.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|144}}: The humans on the island of Gwynneth first come into conflict with the Llewyrr.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|149}}: The human settlements of Gwynneth united to form into the kingdom of [[Corwell]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|154}}: A peace treaty between the elven kingdom of [[Synnoria]] and the human kingdom of Corwell was signed.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|177}}: After a prolonged civil war, [[Callidyrr Hugh]] reunited the fractured kingdom of Corwell.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|201}}: [[Bhaal]] assumed control of Kazgaroth and sent it to destroy the Ffolk. Chieftain [[Cymrych Hugh]] defeated Kazgaroth and was crowned High King. Moonshae Reckoning (MR) marks this year as year one on the Moonshavian calendar.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|250}}: High King Cymrych Hugh died and was entombed within a barrow mound near [[Blackstone]]. He left no heir with a strong claim to the throne, as a result the kingdoms of the Moonshaes splintered.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|256}}:
[[Illuskan]] sailors from [[Tuern]] and [[Gundarlun]] arrive in the Moonshaes, finding the kingdoms at each others throats. This begins centuries of raids against the Ffolk by the Northmen.
[[File:Gwylloch's judgment - Ryan Barger.jpg|thumb|250px|right|''Prince [[Ketheryll]] brings [[Durnhal]] and [[Morgan (queen)|Morgan]] of [[Corwell]] before High King [[Gwylloch]] of the Moonshae Isles for his judgment ([[295 DR]]).'']]
Modern History.{{Yearlink|289}}: High King [[Gwylloch]] constructed the [[Castle of Skulls]] from the skulls of his enemies. The High Kings moved the court to a mighty palace hidden within [[Llyrath Forest]]. He also began a series of raids against the Northlanders. Northmen captured in these raids were brought to the [[Circus Bizarre]], a gladiatorial arena, where they were killed.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|295}}: The son of High King Gwylloch, Prince [[Ketheryll]], captured the King [[Durnhal]] and Queen [[Morgan (queen)|Morgan]] of Corwell. They were executed for treason.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|299}}: High King Gwylloch, Prince Ketheryll and their court begun a slow descent into madness. On the summer solstice, chaos erupted within the Castle of Skull. Everyone inside was slaughtered, killing each other. It was rumored that [[Flamsterd (person)|Flamsterd]] was responsible.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|310}}: On the island of [[Orlumbor]], the [[halfling]] town of [[Marrduin]] is the victim of an attack by [[Gorathil]], a creature from the [[Lower Plane]]s.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|370}}: A convoy of colony ship departs from [[Calimshan]] with the goal to colonize the Moonshaes. A massive storm sinks half the fleet and knocks the remaining ship far off course.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|467}}: A large group of immigrants from [[Tethyr]] arrive to the islands and settled among the Ffolk. The newly arrived Tethyrians bring their religious beliefs with them, but most Ffolk maintain their faith in the Earthmother. Architects and engineers among the immigrants share their knowledge with the Ffolk, allowing the Ffolk to construct improved defensive fortifications. As a result, raids from Northlanders drop over the next few centuries.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|562}}: [[Anhaern Rhyllgallohyr]], Captain of the [[Sisters of Synnoria]], was killed within the [[Fens of the Fallen]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|621}}: While traveling to [[Norland]], Princess [[Bridget]] of Callidyrr and her entire entourage vanished. She was en route to be wed to Prince [[Scothgar]] of [[Rogarsheim]]. Both the Ffolk and Northlanders blamed the other for the disappearance. Ffolk from the Moonshaes arrive in the [[Utter East]]. They began to subjugate the native [[Mar]] tribes and colonize the land.<ref name=tGHotR-p93>
Modern History.{{Yearlink|852}}:
An [[Illuskan]] fleet of [[longship]]s invaded the Moonshaes. High King [[Dolan Cymrych]] was killed when his small fleet of [[coracle]]s was destroyed in [[Whitefish Bay]].
: Losing the battle and the ''Crown'' severely weakened the authority of the High Kings, leading to a fractured effort by the Ffolk to repel the invaders.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|944}}:
The Ffolk capitulated the northern islands to the Illuskan invaders. High King [[Tanner Cymrych]] was killed during a military operation into the [[Myrloch Vale]] to turn back a [[giant]] incursion.{{Cite dragon/362/Grand History of the Realms: The Moonshaes|34}}
: The other noble families also began to change the spellings and pronunciations of their surnames to distance themselves from the Hugh Cymrych name, giving rise to the distinct [[Cambridge]], [[Cyric (family)|Cyric]], [[Kendrick]], [[Kimball]], [[Kincaid]], [[Riker]], and [[Selkirk]] families.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|964}}: The ''[[Lost Harp of Belshareen]]'' was crafted. It was made by Lord [[Ridinlahr]] of the Llewyrr for his new bride [[Belshareen]] of the Ffolk.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|982}}: The famed war captain [[Aeroth of Silverymoon]] and his six sons departed [[Silverymoon]]. They subsequently sailed from [[Waterdeep]] to settle in the Moonshae Isles.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|987}}: A [[dwarf|dwarven]] expedition left from [[Denin's Delve]] beneath the Moonshaes to travel west to [[Maztica]], heading through the [[Underdark]] beneath the [[Trackless Sea]]. This ended in the [[Rockfire Disaster]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1052}}: High King [[Bayle Carrathal]] attempted to annex [[Jannath's Tears]], a small collection of islands. His fleet was defeated when [[Baldur's Gate]] came to the islands defence, and Bayle was subsequently deposed as king.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1107}}: The ''[[Tome of the Unicorn]]'' was lost. The historian [[Bhaernom Khreyt]] was transporting it to the Moonshaes when his ship sank.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1228}}: The islands of the [[Korinn Archipelago]] were brought under the control of the Northlander chieftain [[Viledel]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1291}}: The tower of Flamsterd the mage exploded. The resulting explosion destroyed half of the island of [[Flamsterd (isle)|Flamsterd]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1304}}: Lord [[Kimball]] established [[Cantrev Graystone]] on Gwynneth, and the windswept plain on which it is located came to be known as [[Kimball Moor]].{{Cite dragon/376/Realmslore: Sarifal|64}}
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1330}}: While fighting to prevent the return of Kazgaroth, the Gruid Druid of the Moonshaes [[Brianna Moonsinger]] was killed.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1335}}: King [[Dagdar]] of [[Moray]] was killed while leading an assault against the Northlander village of [[Trondhelm]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1344}}: When the elven [[Retreat]] began, the Llewyrr largely elected not to leave their home.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1345}}: The [[Darkwalker War]] began as agents of Bhaal corrupted one of the Earthmother's [[moonwell]]s. Kazgaroth used this corrupted moonwell to try and kill the Earthmother and destroy the Moonshaes. Kazgaroth took on a human form, known as [[Thelgaar Ironhand]], and invaded Caer Corwell. He was eventually killed by Tristan Kendrick and his allies. This same year, King [[Pwylloch]] of [[Snowdown]] was assassinated.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1346}}:
: Prince Tristan Kendrick married [[Robyn Kendrick|Queen Robyn]] in [[Caer Callidyrr]].
: In a continuing wave of assassinations, King [[Dynnegall]] of [[Moray]] and King [[Bryon Kendrick]] of Corwell were killed.
: Prince Tristan and his allies battled and defeated High King [[Carrathal]]. Carrathal had become an ally of Bhaal. 
: Prince Tristan became the new High King, anointed by the Earthmother.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1347}}: At [[Icepeak (Oman's Isle)|Icepeak]], a peace treaty was signed, bringing peace between the Northlanders and the Ffolk.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1348}}:
: Prince [[Svenyird]] became King of [[Gnarhelm]] after his father King Rolf Olafsson dies.
: [[Alicia Kendrick]] was born.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1353}}: : Lord [[Dagus]] of [[Olafstaad]] sailed for the [[Nelanther Isles]] with a small army of sixty warriors.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1357}}: : [[Chansreena]] [[Alabhansree Alanasker]] of [[Ormpur]] eloped with her lover, the pirate [[Cairak Redbeard]] to the [[Moonshae Isles]], taking several magic weapons and a large quantity of saffron with her to ensure a comfortable life.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1359}}: : [[Gauntather]] the Dark Druid and the priests of the [[Risen Cult of Bane]] arrived in the Moonshaes. Their goal was to spread chaos and fear among the Ffolk as well as battle the [[druid]]s. They used brigands and [[undead]] creatures to accomplish their goals.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1360}}: : Severe weather conditions hit the Moonshaes and last for the next five years. The islands are hit by blizzards, drought, powerful storms and even hurricanes. The adverse weather was caused by [[Talos]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1365}}:
: Robyn Kendrick sensed the imminent return of the Earthmother to the Moonshaes. Angered by her return, Talos attempted to throw the islands into chaos by turning the Ffolk and Northlanders against each other. To achieve this goal, Talos recruited an army of pirates, [[sahuagin]] from [[Kressilacc]] and even a [[dracolich]], [[Gotha]].

: High King Tristan Kendrick traveled to [[Amn]] in a [[galleon]] to negotiate a trade deal. He was seeking large quantities of grain to feed the increasing population of his realms. While making the return voyage, his ship was captured by the [[sea troll]] king [[Krell-Bane]] and brought to [[Kyrasti]]. His left hand was cut off and delivered to his wife, the High Queen Robyn.

: [[Ityak-Ortheel]] was released by [[Malar]] in the [[Myrloch Vale]]. The creature attacked the [[elven]] kingdom of [[Synnoria]]. 

: The greed and ambition for more power of [[Angus Blackstone]], the Earl of [[Fairheight]], was manipulated by Tanos. In exchange for favors from Talos, the Earl was tasked with betraying the throne of the High King. His treachery was exposed and the Earl was executed. His son, [[Hanrold Blackstone]] became the new Earl.

: The dwarven town of [[Cambro]] was sacked by firbolgs led by [[Thurgol]]. [[Troll]]s join his army as it marched north.

: Princess [[Deirdre Kendrick]] aided in the release of the avatar of [[Grond Peaksmasher]]. She was corrupted by Talos and was later killed by her sister Alicia Kendrick.

: High King Tristan Kendrick abdicated his claim to the throne to be with his wife, Queen Robyn. She had left the capital to live in [[Myrloch Vale]] in order to commune with the Earthmother. Alicia Kendrick was now High Queen.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1366}}:
: [[Keane]] married High Queen Alicia, becoming the new High King.

: Prince [[Brandon Olafsson]] became the new king of Gnarhelm.

: Pilgrimages to druid groves all over the Moonshaes increased.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1368}}: : In Myrloch Vale, the wardens of the druid groves started to vanish after receiving summons to enter the moonwells.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1369}}: : Robyn and Tristan Kendrick entered the Great Moonwell in Myrloch Vale to investigate the vanishing druids. They ended up in the [[Feywild]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1370}}:
: In [[Firedrake Bay]], the Royal Navy of the Moonshaes sank twenty ships of the reavers of [[Nelanther]].

: Fey began to arrive in the Moonshaes, traveling through the moonwells. They settled primarily in Myrloch Vale and [[Winterglen Forests]].
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1371}}: : The Northlander kings swore fealty to the High Queen Alicia Kendrick, creating the United Moonshae Isles. This marked the first time that Ffolk and Northlanders become truly united. The Northlander kings adopted the title of Jarl and continued to rule their kingdoms.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1372}}: : Fey and half-fey creatures continued to settle in the Moonshaes, with violent encounters increasing. Human settlements around Myrloch Vale were abandoned.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1373}}:
[[File:Rebirth of sarifal - Ryan Barger.jpg|thumb|250px|right|''The leShay High Lady [[Ordalf]] announces the rebirth of [[Sarifal]].'']]
: [[Hoondarrh]], an ancient [[red dragon]], attacked Caer Callidyrr. Massive fires burned a significant part of the city. Hoondarrh was turned away only after the Great Druid Robyn Kendrick returned from the Feywild, heading to the city with a cohort of powerful druids. High King Keane was killed while defending the city.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1374}}: : In the [[Grampalt Highlands]], firbolg were once again enslaved by the fomorians. The enslaved firbolgs are used to attack the inhabitants of [[Oman's Isle]]. By the middle of summer, the entire island was controlled by the fomorians.
Modern History.{{Yearlink|1375}}:
: The ancient city of Karador surfaced in Myrloch. The return of Sarifal was declared by the fey queen [[Ordalf]], who declared herself ruler of the entirety of Gwynneth.
: The [[planar]] barrier separating the [[Feywild]] from the [[Prime Material plane]] began to weaken in the Moonshaes, permitting otherworldly creatures to pass into Myrloch Vale and the forest of Winterglen.

Post-Spellplague.{{Yearlink|1404}}: : The island of Snowdown came under the control of Amn.{{AmnInSnowdown}} This annexation happened after a slow but steady consolidation of power on the island as well as a civil war against the [[Kendrick Dynasty]] believed to have been supported by Amn.{{Cite dungeon/196/Backdrop: Moonshae Isles|12}}
Post-Spellplague.{{Yearlink|1407}}: : High Queen Alicia Kendrick died unexpectedly. It was commonly believed that she was [[poison]]ed by agents of [[Lionel Carrathal]], the heir to the former [[Carrathal Dynasty]] who claimed to be the "true" High King. The [[Callidyrr dragoon]]s quelled subsequent unrest.{{Cite dragon/405/Heroes of the Moonshaes|5}}
Post-Spellplague.{{Yearlink|1440}}: : [[Branwyn Moonsinger]], the granddaughter to the late High Queen [[Alicia Kendrick]], was made Great Druid of [[Sarifal]].{{Cite dragon/376/Realmslore: Sarifal|61}}
